author: bridge-bot
content:
<felipe> I think it would make a lot of sense to move some types from `consensus-specs` directly into `ethereum-types`. As I understand it, the `execution-specs` team started out with those types internal to their repo and moved them into a separate repo / dependency as `ethereum-types` so that it can serve the purpose of housing their types. If it makes sense to move the SSZ types over there, and any others, that would be quite a beneficial change to try to centralize a lot of common Ethereum Python spec types which can then be imported as a dep to `consensus-specs`, `leanSpec`, and is already the case for `execution-specs`. This would help quite a bit with the current fragmentation and help centralize for readers / implementers where to add new types and import from for specs. If moving out of current consensus-specs doesn't make sense, then at least have leanSpecs start to use it.

author: bridge-bot
content: <felipe> There's a tangential conversation for spec / python maintainers on whether we should move some of the `ethereum/py-ssz` types out of there into `ethereum-types` as well. It seems some of the types for the open `leanSpec` PR above could be leveraged from `py-ssz`. They can stay in there, but moving them eventually to `ethereum-types` into an `ssz` module could be ideal  for sharing types across these repos imo. These seem to re-create a lot of common types internally (e.g. uint64 / U64, etc). But we can move this conversation elsewhere (not sure the appropriate channel for this).
